titles.title: Waiving points of order against the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 4520) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to remove impediments in such Code and make our manufacturing, service, and high-technology businesses and workers more competitive and productive both at home and abroad.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-762, by Mr. Reynolds.
All points of order against the conference report and against its consideration are waived. The conference report shall be considered as read.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 244.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 830.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 10/7/2004--Passed House without amendment. Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report on H.R. 4520 (American Jobs Creation Act of 2004).
